intro: Pilostemon karategina, commonly known as the Karategina trumpetflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Pilostemon karategina thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
